definition: bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to tuck into one's bosom/also written 搋在懷裡|搋在怀里
to tuck into one's bosom/also written 揣在懷裡|揣在怀里

sentences.english: Dumbledore took Harry in his arms and turned toward the Dursleys' house.
sentences.chinese: 邓布利多把哈利抱在怀里，朝德思礼家走去。

sentences.english: Sure I jumped in his arms when he got here.
sentences.chinese: 当然，他进门的时候我扑进了他怀里。

sentences.english: The door opened and in came a woman with a baby in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 门开了，走进一位妇女，怀里抱着个孩子。

sentences.english: She stumbled into my arms and we wept together.
sentences.chinese: 她踉蹒跚跄地扑进我的怀里，我们都哭了。

sentences.english: Said to stretch hand to point to be hugged by the wet nurse looking at in the bosom book sleet goes fishing of Hong Tun.
sentences.chinese: 说着伸手指了被乳母抱在怀里看着书雪钓鱼的弘暾。

sentences.english: Please return to my bosom, for you the second warmth.
sentences.chinese: 请回到我的怀里，给你第二次温暖。

sentences.english: The wife who becomes an emperor a full blood the greatly hugs in the bosom, pain not the desire living.
sentences.chinese: 大成皇上把沁满鲜血的妻子搂在怀里，痛不欲生。

sentences.english: Making cloth falling on her arms was a really interesting part.
sentences.chinese: 让布落在她的怀里真是一个有趣的部分。

sentences.english: Out of his trance Jim seemed quickly to wake. He enfolded his Della.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆好像从恍惚之中醒来，把德拉紧紧地搂在怀里。

sentences.english: As the stun abated , he had found himself in his mother's arms.
sentences.chinese: 定身魔法解除后，他发现自己正躺在母亲的怀里。

sentences.english: The weary setting sun reclines in the arms of west mountain, a dream is ready for midnight.
sentences.chinese: 疲惫的残阳，斜躺在西山的怀里，预备着午夜的梦。

sentences.english: And really, who could blame them for falling all over themselves to get sucked dry by her?
sentences.chinese: 说真的，被她吸干了血死在她怀里，有谁会抱怨呢？

sentences.english: The summer rather embraces the body that the keeping of river vegetable spirit tremble in the bosom.
sentences.chinese: 夏宁把江素气的直抖的身子搂在怀里。

sentences.english: He enfolded the child in an affectionate embrace.
sentences.chinese: 他疼爱那孩子而紧紧搂在怀里。

sentences.english: The time came when the beggar died and the angels carried him to Abraham's side.
sentences.chinese: 后来那讨饭的死了，被天使带去放在亚伯拉罕的怀里。

sentences.english: Tom gives Mary a hug and she relaxes in his arms with a big sigh of relief.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆抱着玛莉，玛莉在他怀里松懈地大叹一声。

definition: to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
